intro: Hieracium vidalianum, commonly known as the Alpina hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and sunny exposures. Its leaves are usually basal, alternate, and have a rough, hairy texture. Hieracium vidalianum produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, contributing to the biodiversity of its high-altitude environment.
